Key Match Events: The Suns had to dig deep to survive the Clippers and capture a 116-113 win in overtime.
James Harden led the Clippers with 29 points and 12 rebounds, while Ivica Zubac had 21 points and nine rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns, anchored by their star trio of Durant, Devin Booker and Bradley Beal, have a fresh start with new head coach Mike Budenholzer as they aim to improve on last season's early playoff exit in the first round.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite the Suns' recent playoff struggles, Kevin Durant has remained a reliable presence, posting averages of 27.1 points, 6.6 rebounds and 5.0 assists per game last season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kevin Durant led the team in scoring with 25 points, while Beal and Booker had 24 and 15, respectively.
Durant still has two years remaining on his current deal and will become an unrestricted free agent after the 2025-26 season.
Others: Suns owner Matt Ishbia reiterated the franchise's commitment to keeping Durant long-term, noting that the two-time champion enjoys playing in Phoenix.
Kevin Durant said contract talks would come at the right time and expressed he would first focus on the season ahead.
